speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: SCENE VIII. London. The palace.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Flourish. Enter KING HENRY VI, WARWICK, MONTAGUE, CLARENCE, EXETER, and OXFORD

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: What counsel, lords? Edward from Belgia,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: With hasty Germans and blunt Hollanders,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Hath pass'd in safety through the narrow seas,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And with his troops doth march amain to London;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And many giddy people flock to him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Let's levy men, and beat him back again.

speaker: CLARENCE
text_entry: A little fire is quickly trodden out;

speaker: CLARENCE
text_entry: Which, being suffer'd, rivers cannot quench.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: In Warwickshire I have true-hearted friends,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Not mutinous in peace, yet bold in war;

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Those will I muster up: and thou, son Clarence,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Shalt stir up in Suffolk, Norfolk, and in Kent,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: The knights and gentlemen to come with thee:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Thou, brother Montague, in Buckingham,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Northampton and in Leicestershire, shalt find

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Men well inclined to hear what thou command'st:

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: And thou, brave Oxford, wondrous well beloved,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: In Oxfordshire shalt muster up thy friends.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: My sovereign, with the loving citizens,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Like to his island girt in with the ocean,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Or modest Dian circled with her nymphs,

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Shall rest in London till we come to him.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Fair lords, take leave and stand not to reply.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Farewell, my sovereign.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Farewell, my Hector, and my Troy's true hope.

speaker: CLARENCE
text_entry: In sign of truth, I kiss your highness' hand.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Well-minded Clarence, be thou fortunate!

speaker: MONTAGUE
text_entry: Comfort, my lord; and so I take my leave.

speaker: OXFORD
text_entry: And thus I seal my truth, and bid adieu.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Sweet Oxford, and my loving Montague,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And all at once, once more a happy farewell.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Farewell, sweet lords: let's meet at Coventry.

speaker: WARWICK
text_entry: Exeunt all but KING HENRY VI and EXETER

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Here at the palace I will rest awhile.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Cousin of Exeter, what thinks your lordship?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Methinks the power that Edward hath in field

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Should not be able to encounter mine.

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: The doubt is that he will seduce the rest.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: That's not my fear; my meed hath got me fame:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I have not stopp'd mine ears to their demands,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Nor posted off their suits with slow delays;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My pity hath been balm to heal their wounds,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My mildness hath allay'd their swelling griefs,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: My mercy dried their water-flowing tears;

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: I have not been desirous of their wealth,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Nor much oppress'd them with great subsidies.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Nor forward of revenge, though they much err'd:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Then why should they love Edward more than me?

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: No, Exeter, these graces challenge grace:

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: And when the lion fawns upon the lamb,

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: The lamb will never cease to follow him.

speaker: KING HENRY VI
text_entry: Shout within. 'A Lancaster! A Lancaster!'

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Hark, hark, my lord! what shouts are these?

speaker: EXETER
text_entry: Enter KING EDWARD IV, GLOUCESTER, and soldiers

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Seize on the shame-faced Henry, bear him hence;

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: And once again proclaim us King of England.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: You are the fount that makes small brooks to flow:

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Now stops thy spring; my sea sha$l suck them dry,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: And swell so much the higher by their ebb.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Hence with him to the Tower; let him not speak.

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Exeunt some with KING HENRY VI

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: And, lords, towards Coventry bend we our course

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Where peremptory Warwick now remains:

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: The sun shines hot; and, if we use delay,

speaker: KING EDWARD IV
text_entry: Cold biting winter mars our hoped-for hay.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Away betimes, before his forces join,

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: And take the great-grown traitor unawares:

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Brave warriors, march amain towards Coventry.

speaker: GLOUCESTER
text_entry: Exeunt
